notes.note:
[Improved private browsing][1] windows block some web page elements that could track your web behavior across sites


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2015/08/14/new-experimental-private-browsing-and-add-ons-features-ready-for-pre-beta-testing-in-firefox/
Control Center that contains site security and privacy controls
Indicator added to tabs that play audio with one-click muting
GTK3 integration (GNU/Linux only)
Hardware acceleration for 2D canvas content (Mac OS X only)

[Process separation][1] enabled by default in Developer Edition

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/Firefox/Multiprocess_Firefox

Login Manager improvements:

- Improved heuristics to save usernames and passwords
- Edit and show all logins in line, Copy/Paste usernames/passwords from the Context menu 
- Migration imports your passwords to Firefox from Google Chrome for Windows and Internet Explorer; import anytime from the Login Manager

WebRTC improvements:

 - IPV6 support
 - Preferences for controlling ICE candidate generation and IP exposure
 - [Hooks for extensions][1] to allow/deny createOffer/Answer
- Improved ability for applications to monitor and control which devices are used in getUserMedia


  [1]: https://hacks.mozilla.org/2015/09/controlling-webrtc-peerconnections-with-an-extension/
Improved performance on interactive websites that trigger a lot of restyles

Implemented [ES6 Reflect][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Reflect

Ship [Push messaging][1] with disabled web notifications from ServiceWorkers


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Push_API

Support [ImageBitmap][1] and [createImageBitmap()][2]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CreateImageBitmap
Media Source Extension for HTML5 video available for all sites

[Remote website debugging][1] over WiFi (no USB cable or ADB needed)


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Tools/Remote_Debugging/Debugging_Firefox_for_Android_over_Wifi
Asynchronous call stacks now allow web developers to follow the code flow through setTimeout, DOM event handlers, and Promise handlers.

Configurable [Firefox OS Simulator][1] in WebIDE, to simulate reference devices like phones, tablets, even TVs


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/WebIDE/Setting_up_runtimes#Configuring_Simulators

[CSS filter presets][1] in the Inspector


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector/How_to/Edit_CSS_filters#Saving_filter_presets

Ability to [save filter presets][1] inside CSS Filter Tooltip


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector/How_to/Edit_CSS_filters#Saving_filter_presets

[Add-on signing][1] enforcement


  [1]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing

The CTRL+K shortcut does not give focus to the search field when used from the URL bar on GNU/Linux with GTK+ 3.14 and 3.16 ([1176929][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1176929

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox, only 32-bit builds of Firefox are supported at this time.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
title: Firefox 42.0a2 Aurora
